page.title: 01ATHERTON & DISTRICT
page.content: DURING THE{CIVIL WAR,}A BATTLE WAS FOUGHT ON THE SITE OF THE{CHOWBENT {CHAPEL. }THE TOWN WAS KNOWN AS CHOWBENT UNTIL THE EARLY 19TH CENTURY WHEN IT ADOPTED THE NAME OF{ATHERTON. EVEN TODAY, SPECIAL PERMISSION IS REQUIRED TO USE THE NAME{'CHOWBENT'. THIS WAS FORMERLY A{MINING AND {COTTON}AREA WHICH, OVER THE PAST FEW YEARS HAS DECLINED. NOWADAYS IT IS A DORMITORY TOWN IN WHICH THE PEOPLE TRAVEL TO{MANCHESTER}AND OTHER CENTRES FOR WORK. NEVERTHELESS, THE PEOPLE HAVE RETAINED THEIR{ATHERTON}IDENTITY, MAINLY BECAUSE IN THE PAST, IT WAS A CLOSE-KNIT COMMUNITY, RELYING TOTALLY ON LOCAL EMPLOYMENT AND WAS SEPARATED FROM THE MAIN CONURBATION OF {MANCHESTER}BY A GREEN BELT. THE FOLLOWING PAGES DETAIL SOME OF THE INTERESTING ASPECTS OF THE AREA.
